qas.question: What does Universal Primary Education belong to?
What is one issue that hurts Universal Primary Education?
Which organization has discovered corruption in the educator sector?
What does Universal Primary Education not belong to?
What is one issue that helps Universal Primary Education?
Which organization has not had corruption in the educator sector?
What parents do not give pressure to their children for schooling?
Who should earn money in the long term instead of short term?

context: Universal Primary Education is one of the eight <a0_0><b3_0>international Millennium Development Goals<b3_0/><a0_0/>, towards which progress has been made in the past decade, though barriers still remain. Securing <a1_0><b4_0>charitable funding<b4_0/><a1_0/> from prospective donors is one particularly persistent problem. Researchers at the Overseas Development Institute have indicated that the main obstacles to funding for education include conflicting donor priorities, an immature aid architecture, and a lack of evidence and advocacy for the issue. Additionally, <a2_0><b5_0>Transparency International<b5_0/><a2_0/> has identified corruption in the education sector as a major stumbling block to achieving Universal Primary Education in Africa. Furthermore, demand in the <b6_0>developing world<b6_0/> for improved educational access is not as high as foreigners have expected. Indigenous governments are reluctant to take on the ongoing costs involved. There is also economic pressure from some parents, who prefer their <b7_0>children<b7_0/> to earn money in the short term rather than work towards the long-term benefits of education.[citation needed]
